overview: Dharamshala is a hill‑station in Himachal Pradesh, famous for its large Tibetan community and the residence of the Dalai Lama. It blends Hindu culture with Tibetan Buddhist heritage and offers a mix of temples, monasteries, trekking routes and colonial‑era architecture.
bestTimeToVisit: Late March to early June and September to November – these months avoid the heavy monsoon (July‑September) and the freezing winter lows.
idealDuration: 2–3 days to explore McLeod Ganj, attend a Dalai Lama teaching, enjoy a short trek and experience the local markets.
travelTips: Carry a heavy winter coat even in March; they are sold cheaply in town.
Avoid travelling during the monsoon (July‑September) as roads become very wet and slippery.
Book HRTC bus tickets online where possible; private Volvo buses from Delhi cost ₹450–₹1,000.
The nearest airport is Kangra (DHM), 15 km from McLeod Ganj; taxis from Pathankot cost about ₹2,200 one‑way.
Narrow, winding hill roads mean travel times are longer than the distance suggests; plan extra time for bus or taxi journeys.
